comments.text:
I made a testcase here: http://jsfiddle.net/XmCKS/.

When you click the first time on one of the links the animation on the img works correctly, however if you click (i.e. blab, blub and again blab) the animation doesn't work on the second click on blab.

In webkit browsers (I tested chrome and chromium so far) the animation works on every click and not just on the first one and as far as i can see this is the correct implementation.

comments.raw_text:
To answer Boris' question, see [1]:

* Setting the display property to none will terminate any running animation 
* applied to the element and its descendants. If an element has a display of none, 
* updating display to a value other than none will start all animations applied to 
* the element by the animation-name property, as well as all animations applied to 
* descendants with display other than none.

Thus the expectation that the animation should run is valid.

Note that the animation will run as expected in Firefox if you move the declarations in li:target img into li:target so Gecko does conform to the spec in that case. (Tested with Aurora 31.0a2)

[1] http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-animations-1/#animations, right below Example 1
